intro: Brassica valentina var. pseudoerucastrum, commonly known as the Valentine's Brassica, is a rare and ornamental variant of the Brassica genus. It is characterized by its striking, bi-colored leaves that range from deep green to vibrant red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, yellow flowers in late spring. It prefers well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it suitable for garden cultivation. Due to its unique appearance, it is often grown for ornamental purposes rather than culinary use.
